intro: Thrincia hispida, commonly known as the rough thrincia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Thrincia hispida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
